NaTakallam – High-quality language services and courses delivered by refugees
I think you can reasonably attribute ~7% of our engineering team to me

stories.text:
I’m looking for good activities that a distributed software engineering team can take a part in for some team-building time. The team has ~10 people. Previously, an online escape room was well received. A small group meets up for semi-regular FPS matches, but it’s not everyone’s cup of tea.

Did you take part in / know of something that could help? Doesn’t need to be free. It’s a once-a-quarter opportunity.

Good hardware and a decent internet connection can be taken for granted.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are good activities for distributed team building?

BLAMP is more efficient for alias reduction than oversampling [audio]

stories.text:
I've been kicking around some ideas for an app that would work by having the user dial in over the phone. I don't really intend to go through with it but I keep thinking about how such a thing would work in practice.

Like how does the I/O work there where a computer is able to receive/send audio from a phone line?

How would such a computer answer the phone in a way that doesn't ever result in a busy signal if many people call this hotline?
stories.title: Ask HN: How would you make an automated telephone hotline?
